claim: The combined global TV audience for the Formula 1 grands prix held outside Asia and Europe in 2010 exceeded 120 million viewers.
reasoning: The claim references 'global TV audience' viewership data, but the database contains no tables or columns related to TV audience, viewership, or broadcast data. The database only contains race results, circuits, drivers, constructors, lap times, pit stops, qualifying, and standings. This is an out-of-schema claim that cannot be verified.

content.text:
I need to first analyze the claim, then check the database schema to see if it contains TV audience data.

The claim references "global TV audience" for Formula 1 races. Let me check if the database has this kind of data.

input.description: List all tables in the F1 database

content.content:
circuits              drivers               results             
constructorResults    lapTimes              seasons             
constructorStandings  pitStops              status              
constructors          qualifying          
driverStandings       races

tool_use_result.stdout:
circuits              drivers               results             
constructorResults    lapTimes              seasons             
constructorStandings  pitStops              status              
constructors          qualifying          
driverStandings       races

input.description: Check schema of circuits and races tables

content.content:
CREATE TABLE circuits
(
    circuitId  INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    circuitRef TEXT default '' not null,
    name       TEXT default '' not null,
    location   TEXT,
    country    TEXT,
    lat        REAL,
    lng        REAL,
    alt        INTEGER,
    url        TEXT default '' not null
        unique
);
---
CREATE TABLE races
(
    raceId    INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    year      INTEGER default 0            not null,
    round     INTEGER default 0            not null,
    circuitId INTEGER default 0            not null,
    name      TEXT    default ''           not null,
    date      DATE    default '0000-00-00' not null,
    time      TEXT,
    url       TEXT unique,
    foreign key (year) references seasons(year),
    foreign key (circuitId) references circuits(circuitId)
);

tool_use_result.stdout:
CREATE TABLE circuits
(
    circuitId  INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    circuitRef TEXT default '' not null,
    name       TEXT default '' not null,
    location   TEXT,
    country    TEXT,
    lat        REAL,
    lng        REAL,
    alt        INTEGER,
    url        TEXT default '' not null
        unique
);
---
CREATE TABLE races
(
    raceId    INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    year      INTEGER default 0            not null,
    round     INTEGER default 0            not null,
    circuitId INTEGER default 0            not null,
    name      TEXT    default ''           not null,
    date      DATE    default '0000-00-00' not null,
    time      TEXT,
    url       TEXT unique,
    foreign key (year) references seasons(year),
    foreign key (circuitId) references circuits(circuitId)
);

content.text:
The database contains tables for circuits, races, drivers, results, etc. — but there is no table or column related to **TV audience** or **viewership data**. The claim specifically references "global TV audience" which is a concept not present anywhere in this database schema.

This is an **OUT-OF-SCHEMA** situation: the claim references data (TV viewership numbers) that simply does not exist in the database.
